image.altText: a building with an orange sky

props.synopsis: Fire crews continues to battle the three major fires on Tasmania's west coast, but cooler temperatures and rainfall today have allowed the downgrading of a number of warnings, including Corinna and surrounds.

title.children: Tasmanians urged to remain alert about the fires as 'weather changes very erratically'

image.altText: A man and woman in fire fighter uniforms toss sleeping supplies in the air.

props.synopsis: As firefighting efforts continue in Tasmania's west, a tent city has been erected on the Tullah sports oval. Meet the people working to provide crews with a home-away-from-home.

title.children: A Tasmanian oval has been transformed into a tent city for firefighters

image.altText: a green steamboat on its side

props.synopsis: Historically significant Tasmanian wooden steamship the MV Cartela has taken on water and partially sunk at its berth in Franklin, south of Hobart, after onboard warning systems failed, the boat's trust has confirmed.

title.children: Salvage crew to refloat Tasmanian steamship Cartela after partial sinking

image.altText: beekeeper holding hive

props.synopsis: A ban on the importation of queen bees from interstate means that more and more Tasmanian beekeepers will use artificial insemination in their apiaries.

title.children: Meet Tasmania's new queen bee makers in fight against varroa mite

image.altText: Basslink cable being laid

props.synopsis: A leading energy analyst says the national energy regulator's decision to knock back Basslink's proposal for regulation could threaten Hydro Tasmania's profits and push up energy prices.

title.children: Basslink owner warns it may have to scoop up Hydro Tasmania's profits instead

image.altText: A bouquet of flowers marked as $10.95.

props.synopsis: Toxic chemicals and cheap imports — your supermarket bouquet for Valentine's Day might not be the bargain you thought it was.

title.children: Why your supermarket Valentine's flowers might have been dipped in weed killer

image.altText: Shein

props.synopsis: Chinese fast fashion app Shein has relaunched in India almost five years after it was banned — some say it's a worrying move.

title.children: Asia's richest man brought Shein back to India — why was it banned?

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: For once, in this parliament, it seemed the government was not just sitting like a hapless duck in the crosshairs of a question time attack.

title.children: Labor takes out its trash ahead of election and Albanese couldn't be happier

image.altText: US Vice President JD Vance speaks at a lecturn in Munich

props.synopsis: Kyiv came back to the US with a revised draft agreement of the deal that could open up its vast resources of key minerals to US investment, after receiving the initial draft accord earlier this week.

title.children: Vance draws German rebuff for 'totally unacceptable' far-right comments

image.altText: A woman looking on with a neutral expression on her face.

props.synopsis: Russia's foreign ministry has criticised the ABC and its Four Corners program over its most recent report, which took audiences inside a Ukrainian drone unit fighting Vladimir Putin's forces.

title.children: Four Corners Ukraine report sparks angry Russian government response

image.altText: Back of Helga Lam next to court justice scales

props.synopsis: The NSW government has agreed to pay $2.5 million in settlements to four men who allege they were sexually abused as teens by a female teacher who could not be criminally prosecuted because a historical charge does not apply to women.

title.children: Four men who allege they were abused by female teacher agree to $2.5m settlement

image.altText: a building with an orange sky

props.synopsis: Firefighters are hoping to consolidate some areas of the fire ground in Tasmania's west over the next few days, but say it's going to be a "long, hard slog" to extinguish the blazes.

title.children: 'Very dark': Locals tell of eerie atmosphere in Tasmania's bushfire-affected west

image.altText: Two men are walking in from of shattered concrete, one with a blue gas tank on his right shoulder and one with a bag.

props.synopsis: Hamas and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad group have revealed three men will be freed on Saturday, days after the fragile Gaza ceasefire was threatened

title.children: Three Israeli hostages to be released from Gaza on Saturday named

image.altText: members of air crash investigation team in US examine parts of debris from Washington DC plane crash

props.synopsis: Preliminary analysis of voice recordings and other black box data recovered from the crash site showed the helicopter pilot and her instructor read aloud conflicting altitudes before the collision.

title.children: 'Bad data' possibly used by Black Hawk crew before Washington DC crash

image.altText: Jay-z 2025

props.synopsis: Jay-Z said in a statement that today was a victory and "the trauma that my wife, my children, my loved ones and I have endured can never be dismissed."

title.children: 'Fictitious and appalling' rape allegations against Jay-Z dismissed

image.altText: A man on a plane connected to medical equipment

props.synopsis: Paul Boon considered himself generally fit and healthy before his first heart attack this year. The 54-year-old was enjoying the waves on his e-foil board when he felt intense pressure in his chest.

title.children: 'It escalated quickly': 54yo man warns others of heart attack signs

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: idol's eye hero

props.synopsis: The pale blue stone has passed through the hands of royals, art collectors, sultans and aristocracy — but who does it belong to now?

title.children: The Idol's Eye diamond is just 2cm wide — and worth more than $27 million

image.altText: Don Farrell Labor caucus

props.synopsis: Don Farrell insisted he wanted to win the crossbench over to his electoral reform bill. They didn't believe him.

title.children: A quip from Don Farrell convinced crossbenchers they'd been 'stitched up'

image.altText: A bald man in a suit and thick framed glasses standing in a blue room with a blurred background.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Police Union says the violent assault of three officers in Brisbane's nightclub precinct is further evidence of growing hostility towards police.

title.children: Police union says officers 'not punching bags' after three hospitalised

image.altText: A female gorilla at Melbourne Zoo

props.synopsis: Vets at Melbourne Zoo are investigating the death of a 20-year-old gorilla named Kimya, who died on Saturday morning.

title.children: Melbourne Zoo investigating sudden death of gorilla

image.altText: A man swimming across a map of New Zealand's North and South Islands

props.synopsis: Clarke wanted to be the first person in almost 40 years to achieve a double crossing of New Zealand's Cook Strait but the brutal conditions had other plans for him.

title.children: Ocean swimmer Craig Clarke 'couldn't keep going' in Cook Strait attempt

image.altText: Matthew Kuhnemann speaks to Steve Smith during a cricket Test in Sri Lanka.

props.synopsis: Acting Australia captain Steve Smith says he is confident Matthew Kuhnemann will be cleared after his bowling action is reviewed by the International Cricket Council.

title.children: Steve Smith surprised Matthew Kuhnemann bowling action reported

image.altText: Two men sit side by side on a bench smiling.

props.synopsis: After Tom Sheppard was diagnosed with autism, a program designed for Australians on the spectrum helped him land a job that plays to his strengths.

title.children: How an autism diagnosis led Tom to making a career change

image.altText: a red car is stuck in a mudslide while a man and a dog walk past

props.synopsis: A climate scientist has said that while the area of Southern California is desperate for rain, this storm might bring too much too quickly.

title.children: Southern California hit by mudslides weeks after devastating fire

image.altText: Interior of a Qantaslink regional aircraft.

props.synopsis: A human exchange on a flight reminded me that it is never too late to rediscover your ability to show compassion for others.

title.children: Kindness can hide in a polarised world but it is there if you look for it

props.synopsis: As Australia's biggest energy generators and retailers, AGL and Origin report their profit results. There are now calls for more to be done to reduce electricity and gas prices.

title.children: 'Energy prices could and should be lower', but are retailers profiteering?

image.altText: Two men in a field holding cameras

props.synopsis: Birdwatchers are pouring billions of dollars into Australia's tourism industry every year with calls to capitalise on the country's native species and better promote the pastime.

title.children: How birdwatching is taking flight as Australia's new tourism goldmine

image.altText: A cowboy on a bucking bull.

props.synopsis: Brady Fielder grew up riding calves on his family's cattle station in outback Queensland. Now he is a frontrunner for a bull riding world title.

title.children: Aussie cowboy follows Troy Dunn's footsteps in hunt for bull riding glory

image.altText: The side of a building with graffiti on the walls and a sign that reads 'Osborne House'

props.synopsis: Boarding houses and hostels were a popular style of living way back when. Could these heritage buildings be repurposed to fit modern-day needs?

title.children: Re-imagining our oldest buildings could help solve the housing crisis

image.altText: A man looking serious, while standing outside.

props.synopsis: Twenty Northern Territory communities are currently signed up to the Local Decision Making program, which the CLP government has confirmed won’t continue after the agreements expire.

title.children: 'Political football': NT land council fury as Aboriginal agreements cut

image.altText: A grey military aircraft flies against a cloudy sky

props.synopsis: China claims Australia provoked an incident on Tuesday where a Chinese fighter jet released flares in front of an Australian military plane in the South China Sea.

title.children: China accuses Australia of 'stirring up trouble' over military plane incident

image.altText: Jordan Mailata shouts into microphones while wearing a backwards visor during Philadelphia's Super Bowl parade.

props.synopsis: Thousands of fans pack the streets of Philadelphia to celebrate the Eagles' victory in Super LIX, with Australian Jordan Mailata getting the whole crowd to join him in song.

title.children: Aussie Mailata leads Philadelphia in song at Eagles' Super Bowl parade

image.altText: Man with old news camera

props.synopsis: Filmmaker Kev Franzi has amassed a treasure trove of items during his 80-year career in the industry, but fears it could all be lost.

title.children: New home sought for century's worth of movie memorabilia

image.altText: A time-lapse shot showing several bolts of lightning in the skies over the Newcastle CBD.

props.synopsis: More than 10 million lightning strikes have been recorded across Australia so far this year, with some causing widespread damage. So how is lightning detected and counted?

title.children: What it takes to count Australia's millions of lightning strikes
